block.p: An article last Sunday about the NewYork-Presbyterian Healthcare System referred incorrectly to the history of hospitals that was chronicled in ''The Care of Strangers: The Rise of America's Hospital System,'' by Charles E. Rosenberg. The number of hospitals in the United States grew from only two in 1800, according to the book; there were not only two in the early 1900s. And a census of hospitals in 1909, not 1920, showed more than 4,300 hospitals housing more than 420,000 beds.
